elements.content:
<ce:figure id="f0005">
<ce:label>Fig. 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0015" view="all">(a) View of the tetrahedral coordination environment of Zn1 in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> with labeling scheme. Symmetry codes: (i) <ce:italic>x</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1/2, <ce:italic>y</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1/2, <ce:italic>z</ce:italic>; (ii) <ce:italic>x</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1/2, <ce:italic>y</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>−<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1/2, <ce:italic>z</ce:italic>. (b) View of the 2D network of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> extending along the <ce:italic>ab</ce:italic> plane. Two crystallographically equivalent nets (yellow and purple) are entangled with each other to form a two-fold interpenetrated structure. (For interpretation of the references to color in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr1"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  (a) View of the tetrahedral coordination environment of Zn1 in 1 with labeling scheme. Symmetry codes: (i) x +1/2, y +1/2, z; (ii) x +1/2, y -1/2, z. (b) View of the 2D network of 1 extending along the ab plane. Two crystallographically equivalent nets (yellow and purple) are entangled with each other to form a two-fold interpenetrated structure. (For interpretation of the references to color in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)

elements.content:
<ce:figure id="f0010">
<ce:label>Fig. 2</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0020" view="all">(a) The linear (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water cluster. (b) View of the interactions between the water cluster and its 2D host framework. (c) The 3D supramolecular network of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. The pink dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds in water cluster. The cyan dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds between water molecules and carboxylate groups in the 2D coordination network. The blue dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds between the adjacent 2D coordination networks. Symmetry code: (iv) −<ce:italic>x</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1, <ce:italic>y</ce:italic>, −<ce:italic>z</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>+<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1/2. (For interpretation of the references to color in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr2"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
elements.clean_text: Fig. 2  (a) The linear (H2O)5 water cluster. (b) View of the interactions between the water cluster and its 2D host framework. (c) The 3D supramolecular network of 1. The pink dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds in water cluster. The cyan dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds between water molecules and carboxylate groups in the 2D coordination network. The blue dashed connections represent hydrogen bonds between the adjacent 2D coordination networks. Symmetry code: (iv) -x +1, y, -z +1/2. (For interpretation of the references to color in this figure legend, the reader is referred to the web version of this article.)

<ce:figure id="f0015">
<ce:label>Fig. 3</ce:label>
<ce:caption>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0025" view="all">Solid state emission spectra of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and 1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda ligand at ambient temperature. Inset: solid state excitation spectra of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and 1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda ligand.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<ce:link locator="gr3"></ce:link>
</ce:figure>
elements.clean_text: Fig. 3  Solid state emission spectra of 1 and 1,3-H2pda ligand at ambient temperature. Inset: solid state excitation spectra of 1 and 1,3-H2pda ligand.

<ce:section-title>Highlights</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="sp0005" view="all">► A two-fold interpenetrating 2D 4<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>-sql coordination network has been synthesized. ► The 2D coordination polymer encapsulates discrete linear (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water clusters. ► The water clusters were stabilized by hydrogen bonds. ► The water clusters linked the entangled 2D nets into a 3D supramolecular framework.</ce:simple-para>

Highlights

► A two-fold interpenetrating 2D 44-sql coordination network has been synthesized. ► The 2D coordination polymer encapsulates discrete linear (H2O)5 water clusters. ► The water clusters were stabilized by hydrogen bonds. ► The water clusters linked the entangled 2D nets into a 3D supramolecular framework.

</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>) (1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1,3-phenylene-diacrylic acid, bpp<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)-propane) was obtained from the hydrothermal reaction of Zn(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, 1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda, bpp in a 1:1:1 molar ratio in the presence of NaOH. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis reveals that <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> is a two-fold interpenetrating two-dimensional network containing small cavities. Within each cavity of the entangled network, five water molecules are aggregated to form an unique discrete linear (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water cluster. Thermal and luminescent properties of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were also investigated.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The coordination polymer {[Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O} n  (1) (1,3-H2pda=1,3-phenylene-diacrylic acid, bpp=1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)-propane) was obtained from the hydrothermal reaction of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, 1,3-H2pda, bpp in a 1:1:1 molar ratio in the presence of NaOH. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis reveals that 1 is a two-fold interpenetrating two-dimensional network containing small cavities. Within each cavity of the entangled network, five water molecules are aggregated to form an unique discrete linear (H2O)5 water cluster. Thermal and luminescent properties of 1 were also investigated.

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Introduction</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0005" view="all">Water is one of the most important fundamental substances in nature. It is involved in almost all the natural and biological processes and plays a critical role in natural processes and life-sustaining processes . The key to understanding the behavior of water is the precise structures of different hydrogen-bonded water aggregates in various host environments . Therefore, studies of hydrogen-bonded water aggregates, that is, water clusters, are of special importance in understanding of the behavior of water in nature and biochemistry . In order to investigate the structure and function of water, much attention has been focused on exploring new kinds of water clusters in various host environments . It is well-known that water molecules play different roles in the stabilization of host frameworks and exhibit a variety of geometries in the crystal structures and confined environments . In other words, water clusters could assume different arrangements such as discrete clusters , one-dimensional (1D) chains , 1D tapes , two-dimensional (2D) layers  and three-dimensional (3D) networks  under different crystal environments. Among the water clusters, discrete water clusters are particularly interesting , for example, the water decamer and hexamer are dominant form in ice and bulk water . To date, the discrete water clusters including trimer, tetramer, hexamer, octamer, nonamer and decamer water morphologies found in the crystalline hosts have been structurally characterized . The water molecules in these discrete water clusters are orderly arranged and aggregated to cyclic, cubelike or diamondoid structures . Recently, studies of linear water clusters are prevalent owing to their importance in protein structures . These conformations of water molecules are essential for biological activity .</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Water is one of the most important fundamental substances in nature. It is involved in almost all the natural and biological processes and plays a critical role in natural processes and life-sustaining processes . The key to understanding the behavior of water is the precise structures of different hydrogen-bonded water aggregates in various host environments . Therefore, studies of hydrogen-bonded water aggregates, that is, water clusters, are of special importance in understanding of the behavior of water in nature and biochemistry . In order to investigate the structure and function of water, much attention has been focused on exploring new kinds of water clusters in various host environments . It is well-known that water molecules play different roles in the stabilization of host frameworks and exhibit a variety of geometries in the crystal structures and confined environments . In other words, water clusters could assume different arrangements such as discrete clusters , one-dimensional (1D) chains , 1D tapes , two-dimensional (2D) layers  and three-dimensional (3D) networks  under different crystal environments. Among the water clusters, discrete water clusters are particularly interesting , for example, the water decamer and hexamer are dominant form in ice and bulk water . To date, the discrete water clusters including trimer, tetramer, hexamer, octamer, nonamer and decamer water morphologies found in the crystalline hosts have been structurally characterized . The water molecules in these discrete water clusters are orderly arranged and aggregated to cyclic, cubelike or diamondoid structures . Recently, studies of linear water clusters are prevalent owing to their importance in protein structures . These conformations of water molecules are essential for biological activity .

elements.content: <ce:para id="p0010" view="all">The crystalline hosts for water clusters can be organic compounds, inorganic compounds or organic–inorganic hybrid coordination polymers . Among them, coordination polymers are more prone to work as a water cluster host since the choice of a certain combination of discrete molecular units can lead to the formation of desired extended network with appropriate voids for water hosting. In recent years, entangled systems of coordination polymers are currently of great interest owing to their intriguing molecular topologies and potential applications as functional materials . These species usually contain two or more independent networks that are inextricably entangled through the rings belonging to one framework. The topologies of coordination polymers can be determined by several factors such as organic ligands, metal ions, solvents, templates, pH values and so on . Among these factors, selection of appropriate organic ligands in an assembly system is always a preferred method to control or modify the structure of a complex . Usually, long flexible ligands will lead to large voids that may result in interpenetrated structures. In our previous work, we found that the mixed dicarboxylates and dipyridyl ligands are good candidates for the preparation of coordination polymers . Thus, a long flexible dicarboxylate 1,3-phenylene-diacrylic acid (1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda) and a long flexible dipyridyl ligand 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)-propane (bpp) were selected as linkers for the construction of entangled framework. We anticipated an entangled network with unique water clusters in its voids could be obtained.</ce:para>

Among them, coordination polymers are more prone to work as a water cluster host since the choice of a certain combination of discrete molecular units can lead to the formation of desired extended network with appropriate voids for water hosting. In recent years, entangled systems of coordination polymers are currently of great interest owing to their intriguing molecular topologies and potential applications as functional materials . These species usually contain two or more independent networks that are inextricably entangled through the rings belonging to one framework. The topologies of coordination polymers can be determined by several factors such as organic ligands, metal ions, solvents, templates, pH values and so on . Among these factors, selection of appropriate organic ligands in an assembly system is always a preferred method to control or modify the structure of a complex . Usually, long flexible ligands will lead to large voids that may result in interpenetrated structures. In our previous work, we found that the mixed dicarboxylates and dipyridyl ligands are good candidates for the preparation of coordination polymers . Thus, a long flexible dicarboxylate 1,3-phenylene-diacrylic acid (1,3-H2pda) and a long flexible dipyridyl ligand 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)-propane (bpp) were selected as linkers for the construction of entangled framework. We anticipated an entangled network with unique water clusters in its voids could be obtained.

elements.clean_text:
Experimental

Materials and physical measurements

All chemicals and reagents were obtained from commercial sources and used as received. Infrared (IR) samples were prepared as KBr pellets, and spectrum was obtained in the 4000-400cm-1 range using a Nicolet Avatar 360 FT-IR spectrophotometer. The elemental analyses for C, H, and N were performed on an EA1110 CHNS elemental analyzer. Powder XRD patterns were obtained using a PANalytical X'Pert PRO MPD system (PW3040/60). Thermal analysis was performed with a Perkin_Elmer TGA-7 thermogravimetric analyzer at a heating rate of 10°C/min and a flow rate of 100cm3/min (N2). The photoluminescent spectra were obtained on a JASCO FP-8600 spectrofluorometer.

The autoclave was sealed and heated in an oven to 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for two days, and then cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 5°Ch<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, resulting in the formation of colorless crystalline product <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of complex {[Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O}n (1)

A mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O (149mg, 0.5mmol), 1,3-H2pda (95mg, 0.5mmol), bpp (100mg, 0.5mmol), NaOH (40mg, 1mmol) and deionized water (15mL) were loaded into a 25mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The autoclave was sealed and heated in an oven to 160°C for two days, and then cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 5°Ch-1, resulting in the formation of colorless crystalline product 1. Yield: 163mg (62% yield based on Zn). Anal. Calcd for C50H54N4O13Zn2: C, 57.21; H, 5.18; N, 5.34%. Found: C, 57.61; H, 5.32; N, 5.42%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3447(br), 3058(m), 2920(m), 1606(s), 1566(s), 1540(s), 1495(m), 1475(m), 1426(m), 1384(s), 1315(m), 1270(w), 1220(m), 1070(m), 1015(m), 822(m), 781(s), 743(s), 718(m), 698(m), 547(m), 531(w), 431(w).

elements.clean_text:
X-ray crystallography

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for 1 was collected on a Bruker SMART APEX II CCD diffractometer equipped with graphite-monochromated Mo Kα (λ =0.71073Å) by using the Φ/ω scan technique. Absorption correction was based on symmetry equivalent reflections using the SADABS program . The crystal structure of 1 was solved by direct methods and refined on F 2 by full-matrix least-squares methods with the SHELXL-97 program . All non-hydrogen atoms refined anisotropically. The H atoms of the water solvent molecule in 1 were located from the Fourier map and included in the final refinement by use of geometrical restraints with the O-H distances being fixed at 0.85Å and U iso(H) equivalent to 1.5 times of U eq(O). All other H atoms were introduced at the calculated positions and included in the structure-factor calculations. A summary of key crystallographic information for 1 was given in  . Selected bond lengths and angles for 1 were listed in  . The hydrogen bond geometries for 1 were shown in  .

elements.content:
<ce:section-title>Results and discussions</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>Synthesis and general characterization</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">Hydrothermal treatment of a mixture of Zn(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, 1,3-H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda, bpp and NaOH in a 1:1:1:2 molar ratio at 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for two days followed by slow cooling to room temperature gives rise to colorless crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> is air-stable and insoluble in common solvents. The elemental analysis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was consistent with its chemical formulas. The IR spectrum of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> () exhibits strong absorptions centered at ∼3447<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> corresponding to the O–H stretching vibration of the lattice water molecule. The IR spectrum also shows strong peaks in the range of 1550–1615<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> and 1314–1475<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, indicating that the complex contains coordinated carboxylic groups. The peaks at about 822<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> and 431<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> mean the existence of pyridyl groups in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
. The identity of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was further confirmed by single-crystal diffraction analysis. The powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) pattern of the bulk sample of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was matched with the simulated pattern generated from the single crystal X-ray diffraction data (), which clearly confirms the phase purity of the as-prepared product.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Results and discussions

Synthesis and general characterization

Hydrothermal treatment of a mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, 1,3-H2pda, bpp and NaOH in a 1:1:1:2 molar ratio at 160°C for two days followed by slow cooling to room temperature gives rise to colorless crystals of 1. 1 is air-stable and insoluble in common solvents. The elemental analysis of 1 was consistent with its chemical formulas. The IR spectrum of 1 () exhibits strong absorptions centered at ~3447cm-1 corresponding to the O-H stretching vibration of the lattice water molecule. The IR spectrum also shows strong peaks in the range of 1550-1615cm-1 and 1314-1475cm-1, indicating that the complex contains coordinated carboxylic groups. The peaks at about 822cm-1 and 431cm-1 mean the existence of pyridyl groups in 1 . The identity of 1 was further confirmed by single-crystal diffraction analysis. The powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) pattern of the bulk sample of 1 was matched with the simulated pattern generated from the single crystal X-ray diffraction data (), which clearly confirms the phase purity of the as-prepared product.

elements.content:
<ce:section-title>Crystal structure of {[Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(1,3-pda)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(bpp)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold> Crystallizes in the monoclinic space group <ce:italic>C</ce:italic>2/<ce:italic>c</ce:italic>, and its asymmetric unit contains half a [Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(1,3-pda)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(bpp)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] unit and two and a half of water molecules. Each Zn atom is tetrahedrally coordinated by two O atoms from different 1,3-pda ligands and two N atoms from different bpp ligands (
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0005"></ce:float-anchor>a). Each 1,3-pda ligand bridges two metal ions <ce:italic>via</ce:italic> bis-monodentate coordination mode to form a 1D wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> chain (b). Meanwhile, the bpp ligands link the Zn center in one chain to a Zn center in an adjacent chain, forming a 2D 4<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>-sql network  of [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> extending along the <ce:italic>ab</ce:italic> plane (b). Each parallelgrammic grid in this 2D net has a dimension of 12.64<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>×<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>12.64<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>. Owing to the existence of –CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>–CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>–CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>– group in it, the bpp ligand can adopt different conformations (<ce:italic>TT</ce:italic>, <ce:italic>TG</ce:italic>, <ce:italic>GG</ce:italic> and <ce:italic>GG′</ce:italic>; <ce:italic>T</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>
<ce:italic>Trans</ce:italic>, <ce:italic>G</ce:italic>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>
<ce:italic>Gauge</ce:italic>) under different conditions . In <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, the bpp ligands adopt <ce:italic>TG</ce:italic> conformation. It is noted that the <ce:italic>TG</ce:italic>-bpp ligands and Zn atoms also linked into wave-like [Zn(bpp)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> chains perpendicular to the wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> chain, which makes the 2D [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> into a thick undulated 2D network. The large grids of the network and the highly undulated nature of the single 4<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>-sql net produced enough space to allow the other crystallographically equivalent net to penetrate to form a two-fold interpenetrating 2D parallel network (b).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Crystal structure of {[Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O}n (1)

 1 Crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/c, and its asymmetric unit contains half a [Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2] unit and two and a half of water molecules. Each Zn atom is tetrahedrally coordinated by two O atoms from different 1,3-pda ligands and two N atoms from different bpp ligands ( a). Each 1,3-pda ligand bridges two metal ions via bis-monodentate coordination mode to form a 1D wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)] n  chain (b). Meanwhile, the bpp ligands link the Zn center in one chain to a Zn center in an adjacent chain, forming a 2D 44-sql network  of [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)] n  extending along the ab plane (b). Each parallelgrammic grid in this 2D net has a dimension of 12.64×12.64Å2. Owing to the existence of -CH2-CH2-CH2- group in it, the bpp ligand can adopt different conformations (TT, TG, GG and GG'; T = Trans, G = Gauge) under different conditions . In 1, the bpp ligands adopt TG conformation. It is noted that the TG-bpp ligands and Zn atoms also linked into wave-like [Zn(bpp)] n  chains perpendicular to the wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)] n  chain, which makes the 2D [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)] n  into a thick undulated 2D network. The large grids of the network and the highly undulated nature of the single 44-sql net produced enough space to allow the other crystallographically equivalent net to penetrate to form a two-fold interpenetrating 2D parallel network (b).

elements.content:
<ce:para id="p0040" view="all">The void space of each single net is mainly filled by interpenetration, leaving only small cavities to host the guest molecules (the effective solvent accessible volume is 575.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup> per unit cell, about 12% of the total cell volume (calculated by the Platon program )). Within each cavity of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, five water molecules are aggregated <ce:italic>via</ce:italic> hydrogen bonding interactions (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O2W–H2W1⋯O1W 130.6°; O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O3W–H3W⋯O2W 172.5°) to form a linear (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water cluster (
<ce:float-anchor refid="f0010"></ce:float-anchor>a). The O⋯O distances (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å) in the (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> cluster are comparable with those found in ice <ce:italic>I<ce:inf loc="post">c</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (2.74<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å) [2a], ice <ce:italic>I<ce:inf loc="post">h</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (2.76<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å)  and liquid water (2.85<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å) . The water cluster is anchored by the O1W–H1W2⋯O2 (O1W⋯O2 2.789(4)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O1W–H1W2⋯O2 170.2°) and O2W–H2W2⋯O3 (O2W⋯O3 3.071(6)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O2W–H2W2···O3 151.2°) hydrogen bonding interactions between guest water cluster and the carboxylate groups in host framework. As shown in b, the size of cavity between two crystallographically equivalent nets is very suitable for the accommodation of (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> cluster. Furthermore, the water cluster could be stabilized by complementary hydrogen-bonded interactions between host and guest. Thus, the formation of such a water cluster mainly depends on the cooperative result of suitable size, geometry, and host–guest match between the entangled network and the water cluster. The adjacent entangled 2D coordination networks are further interconnected by O1W–H1W1⋯O4 (O1W–H1W1⋯O4 2.860(5)<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å, O1W–H1W1⋯O4 151.1°) hydrogen bonds to form a 3D supramolecular framework (c).</ce:para>
elements.clean_text: The void space of each single net is mainly filled by interpenetration, leaving only small cavities to host the guest molecules (the effective solvent accessible volume is 575.3Å3 per unit cell, about 12% of the total cell volume (calculated by the Platon program )). Within each cavity of 1, five water molecules are aggregated via hydrogen bonding interactions (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)Å, O2W-H2W1⋯O1W 130.6°; O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)Å, O3W-H3W⋯O2W 172.5°) to form a linear (H2O)5 water cluster ( a). The O⋯O distances (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)Å, O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)Å) in the (H2O)5 cluster are comparable with those found in ice Ic  (2.74Å) [2a], ice Ih  (2.76Å)  and liquid water (2.85Å) . The water cluster is anchored by the O1W-H1W2⋯O2 (O1W⋯O2 2.789(4)Å, O1W-H1W2⋯O2 170.2°) and O2W-H2W2⋯O3 (O2W⋯O3 3.071(6)Å, O2W-H2W2⋅⋅⋅O3 151.2°) hydrogen bonding interactions between guest water cluster and the carboxylate groups in host framework. As shown in b, the size of cavity between two crystallographically equivalent nets is very suitable for the accommodation of (H2O)5 cluster. Furthermore, the water cluster could be stabilized by complementary hydrogen-bonded interactions between host and guest. Thus, the formation of such a water cluster mainly depends on the cooperative result of suitable size, geometry, and host-guest match between the entangled network and the water cluster. The adjacent entangled 2D coordination networks are further interconnected by O1W-H1W1⋯O4 (O1W-H1W1⋯O4 2.860(5)Å, O1W-H1W1⋯O4 151.1°) hydrogen bonds to form a 3D supramolecular framework (c).

elements.clean_text:
Thermal and photoluminescence properties

Thermogravimetric analysis of 1 () showed a first weight loss of 8.82% in the range of 40-120°C, which corresponds to five H2O molecules per formula unit and is consistent with the formula of {[Zn2(1,3-PDA)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O} n  (ca. 8.58%). 1 is stable up to 175°C. When the temperature rises, a series of decomposition steps commence, the weight of the final residue (15.85%) was assumed to be ZnO (ca. 15.51%).

elements.clean_text: The photoluminescence properties of 1 along with 1,3-H2pda ligand in the solid state have been investigated at ambient temperature ( ). Excitation of 1 at 374nm resulted in a strong emission band at 437nm. The maximum emission wavelength for bpp (λ ex =350nm) appears at 446nm  while that of 1,3-H2pda (λ ex =377nm) appears at 451nm. Comparing with the photoluminescence properties of bpp and 1,3-H2pda ligands, the observed emission of complexes 1 is probably contributed by the π-π* intraligand fluorescence since similar emissions were also observed for the ligands itself .

elements.content: <ce:section-title>Conclusions</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0055" view="all">In summary, the present work demonstrated that a two-fold interpenetrating 2D coordination polymer with novel discrete linear (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water clusters in its cavities was prepared through hydrothermal reaction. The formation of such unique water cluster may be greatly determined by the surrounding environment provided by the host coordination network. Meanwhile, the (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf> water cluster plays an important templating role in directing the formation of the entangled structure and the void space between two crystallographically equivalent 2D network.</ce:para>
elements.clean_text:
Conclusions

In summary, the present work demonstrated that a two-fold interpenetrating 2D coordination polymer with novel discrete linear (H2O)5 water clusters in its cavities was prepared through hydrothermal reaction. The formation of such unique water cluster may be greatly determined by the surrounding environment provided by the host coordination network. Meanwhile, the (H2O)5 water cluster plays an important templating role in directing the formation of the entangled structure and the void space between two crystallographically equivalent 2D network.

Synthesis of complex {[Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O}n (1)

A mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O (149mg, 0.5mmol), 1,3-H2pda (95mg, 0.5mmol), bpp (100mg, 0.5mmol), NaOH (40mg, 1mmol) and deionized water (15mL) were loaded into a 25mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The autoclave was sealed and heated in an oven to 160°C for two days, and then cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 5°Ch-1, resulting in the formation of colorless crystalline product 1. Yield: 163mg (62% yield based on Zn). Anal. Calcd for C50H54N4O13Zn2: C, 57.21; H, 5.18; N, 5.34%. Found: C, 57.61; H, 5.32; N, 5.42%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3447(br), 3058(m), 2920(m), 1606(s), 1566(s), 1540(s), 1495(m), 1475(m), 1426(m), 1384(s), 1315(m), 1270(w), 1220(m), 1070(m), 1015(m), 822(m), 781(s), 743(s), 718(m), 698(m), 547(m), 531(w), 431(w).

cln_elements.clean_text:
Results and discussions

Synthesis and general characterization

Hydrothermal treatment of a mixture of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, 1,3-H2pda, bpp and NaOH in a 1:1:1:2 molar ratio at 160°C for two days followed by slow cooling to room temperature gives rise to colorless crystals of 1. 1 is air-stable and insoluble in common solvents. The elemental analysis of 1 was consistent with its chemical formulas. The IR spectrum of 1 () exhibits strong absorptions centered at ~3447cm-1 corresponding to the O-H stretching vibration of the lattice water molecule. The IR spectrum also shows strong peaks in the range of 1550-1615cm-1 and 1314-1475cm-1, indicating that the complex contains coordinated carboxylic groups. The peaks at about 822cm-1 and 431cm-1 mean the existence of pyridyl groups in 1 . The identity of 1 was further confirmed by single-crystal diffraction analysis. The powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) pattern of the bulk sample of 1 was matched with the simulated pattern generated from the single crystal X-ray diffraction data (), which clearly confirms the phase purity of the as-prepared product.

Crystal structure of {[Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O}n (1)

 1 Crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/c, and its asymmetric unit contains half a [Zn2(1,3-pda)2(bpp)2] unit and two and a half of water molecules. Each Zn atom is tetrahedrally coordinated by two O atoms from different 1,3-pda ligands and two N atoms from different bpp ligands ( a). Each 1,3-pda ligand bridges two metal ions via bis-monodentate coordination mode to form a 1D wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)] n  chain (b). Meanwhile, the bpp ligands link the Zn center in one chain to a Zn center in an adjacent chain, forming a 2D 44-sql network  of [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)] n  extending along the ab plane (b). Each parallelgrammic grid in this 2D net has a dimension of 12.64×12.64Å2. Owing to the existence of -CH2-CH2-CH2- group in it, the bpp ligand can adopt different conformations (TT, TG, GG and GG'; T = Trans, G = Gauge) under different conditions . In 1, the bpp ligands adopt TG conformation. It is noted that the TG-bpp ligands and Zn atoms also linked into wave-like [Zn(bpp)] n  chains perpendicular to the wave-like [Zn(1,3-pda)] n  chain, which makes the 2D [Zn(1,3-pda)(bpp)] n  into a thick undulated 2D network. The large grids of the network and the highly undulated nature of the single 44-sql net produced enough space to allow the other crystallographically equivalent net to penetrate to form a two-fold interpenetrating 2D parallel network (b).

The void space of each single net is mainly filled by interpenetration, leaving only small cavities to host the guest molecules (the effective solvent accessible volume is 575.3Å3 per unit cell, about 12% of the total cell volume (calculated by the Platon program )). Within each cavity of 1, five water molecules are aggregated via hydrogen bonding interactions (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)Å, O2W-H2W1⋯O1W 130.6°; O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)Å, O3W-H3W⋯O2W 172.5°) to form a linear (H2O)5 water cluster ( a). The O⋯O distances (O2W⋯O1W 2.728(4)Å, O3W⋯O2W 2.873(4)Å) in the (H2O)5 cluster are comparable with those found in ice Ic  (2.74Å) [2a], ice Ih  (2.76Å)  and liquid water (2.85Å) . The water cluster is anchored by the O1W-H1W2⋯O2 (O1W⋯O2 2.789(4)Å, O1W-H1W2⋯O2 170.2°) and O2W-H2W2⋯O3 (O2W⋯O3 3.071(6)Å, O2W-H2W2⋅⋅⋅O3 151.2°) hydrogen bonding interactions between guest water cluster and the carboxylate groups in host framework. As shown in b, the size of cavity between two crystallographically equivalent nets is very suitable for the accommodation of (H2O)5 cluster. Furthermore, the water cluster could be stabilized by complementary hydrogen-bonded interactions between host and guest. Thus, the formation of such a water cluster mainly depends on the cooperative result of suitable size, geometry, and host-guest match between the entangled network and the water cluster. The adjacent entangled 2D coordination networks are further interconnected by O1W-H1W1⋯O4 (O1W-H1W1⋯O4 2.860(5)Å, O1W-H1W1⋯O4 151.1°) hydrogen bonds to form a 3D supramolecular framework (c).

Thermal and photoluminescence properties

Thermogravimetric analysis of 1 () showed a first weight loss of 8.82% in the range of 40-120°C, which corresponds to five H2O molecules per formula unit and is consistent with the formula of {[Zn2(1,3-PDA)2(bpp)2]⋅5H2O} n  (ca. 8.58%). 1 is stable up to 175°C. When the temperature rises, a series of decomposition steps commence, the weight of the final residue (15.85%) was assumed to be ZnO (ca. 15.51%).

The photoluminescence properties of 1 along with 1,3-H2pda ligand in the solid state have been investigated at ambient temperature ( ). Excitation of 1 at 374nm resulted in a strong emission band at 437nm. The maximum emission wavelength for bpp (λ ex =350nm) appears at 446nm  while that of 1,3-H2pda (λ ex =377nm) appears at 451nm. Comparing with the photoluminescence properties of bpp and 1,3-H2pda ligands, the observed emission of complexes 1 is probably contributed by the π-π* intraligand fluorescence since similar emissions were also observed for the ligands itself .

decomposition temperature.condition: corresponds to five H2O molecules per formula unit
